name: treatment of waste paperboard, unsorted, sorting | waste paperboard, sorted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10471/documentation

This activity represents the treatment of 1 kg waste paperboard (cardboard) from separate collection, i.e. a source-segregated municipal solid waste fraction, through sorting for recycling. The activity starts with receiving the unsorted waste paperboard, as collected from the households, at the sorting facility and ends when sorted fractions are produced. 

The activity starts with "waste paperboard, unsorted" being available to the sorting facility.

The activity ends with "waste paperboard, unsorted" being sorted and "waste paperboard, sorted" available for transportation at the gate of the sorting facility.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset for GLO has been extrapolated from the corresponding activity in Switzerland. The uncetainty information has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
The inventory available in ecoinvent 3.3 (cut-off) for “treatment of waste paper, unsorted, sorting {CH}” was used as a proxy for the sorting process of waste paperboard (cardboard) assuming that the energy need, auxiliary materials and waste content were similar. However, all the waste material flows were replaced with the values reported in the material flow analysis in Haupt et al. (2017). 
For more detail see the supporting information in M. Haupt et al. (2018), Life cycle inventories of waste management processes, Data in Brief 19 (2018) 1441-1457.
Reference: M. Haupt, C. Vadenbo, S. Hellweg, (2017) Do we have the right performance indicators for the circular economy?: insightin tothe Swiss Waste Management System, J.Ind.Ecol. 21 (2017) 615-627, http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/jiec.12506.

defaultProvider.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

exchanges.description:
The inventory available in ecoinvent 3.3 (cut-off) for “treatment of waste paper, unsorted, sorting {CH}” was used as a proxy for the sorting process of waste paperboard (cardboard) assuming that the energy need, auxiliary materials and waste content were similar. However, all the waste material flows were replaced with the values reported in the material flow analysis in Haupt et al. (2017). 
For more detail see the supporting information in M. Haupt et al. (2018), Life cycle inventories of waste management processes, Data in Brief 19 (2018) 1441-1457.
Reference: M. Haupt, C. Vadenbo, S. Hellweg, (2017) Do we have the right performance indicators for the circular economy?: insightin tothe Swiss Waste Management System, J.Ind.Ecol. 21 (2017) 615-627, http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/jiec.12506.
